title: Derby County star Richard Keogh won't play until December NEXT YEAR with two ruptured ligaments
text:
Former Derby County captain Richard Keogh has been ruled out of action for 15 months after being involved in a car crash last week.

Keogh was rescued by paramedics who found him unconscious, and the 33-year-old suffered a potentially career-threatening injury to his knee.

A Range Rover, believed to have been driven by team-mate Tom Lawrence, slammed into a tree after colliding with a stationary Mercedes SUV and Keogh was a passenger in the back.

Richard Keogh has been ruled out until December 2020 after being involved in a car crash

Keogh was a passenger in the back of a black SUV when it crashed in Allestree area of Derby

Mason Bennett was believed to have been at the wheel of the Mercedes and both he and Lawrence face sanctions, having chosen to drive home rather than use transport which was said to have been offered by the club.

The aftermath of the horror crash has been the talk of football since details first emerged of the late-night incident on Tuesday.

The collision took place on the A6 near Allestree, Derby when Bennett stopped at a road junction.

All three players from the Championship side had been at a bonding session arranged by the club and were said to have spent hours boozing at a pub after the official dinner ended.

At 33, Keogh's playing career is now in serious doubt as he won't return until December 2020

Keogh's playing career has now been put in serious doubt given he will not return to action until December 2020.

He will have just three months left on his deal with the club when he makes his return and boss Phillip Cocu revealed that the skipper feels 'extremely down' about the whole situation.

'I've spoken to him. He was here [at the training ground] for a short moment and I spoke briefly to him because there's a lot going on,' Cocu told Sky Sports over the weekend.

'He's extremely down, of course, because he realises what's going on for him personally and of course as a responsible player, as captain, to not be part of the team any more does something to you. I think he feels responsible, yeah.

'The more senior players always have to step up and take responsibility and it's now had a huge effect on him personally. It's a lot to deal with for him.'

Curtis Davies, the club's new captain following the incident, called on the club's supporters to welcome back the players involved in the crash.
description: Derby County captain Richard Keogh has been ruled out of action for 15 months having ruptured two ligaments after being involved in a car crash last week which puts his career in doubt.
